#Text=Zhu Chenhao
#Text=Zhu Chenhao ( 朱宸濠 ) ( died 12 January 1521 ) or Prince of Ning ( 寜王 ) ( ruled 1499 – 1521 ) was a member of the Ming Dynasty 's Royal Family .
#Text=He was the 5th generation descendant of Zhu Quan , the seventeenth son of the Hongwu Emperor .
#Text=He attempted to usurp the throne and was the leader of the Prince of Ning rebellion .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Zhu Chenhao was not a military man , but had literary talents and was a pleasure seeker .
#Text=However , he was cunning and ambitious like almost all other princes , aiming to become Emperor .
#Text=Zhu Chenhao succeeded to the title " Prince Of Ning " in 1499 from his father , Zhu Jinjun in Hongzhi 's era .
#Text=The title was hereditary , from their ancestor Zhu Quan , the first Prince Of Ning .
#Text=Zhu Chenhao lived in Jiangxi province , far away from the Ming capital .
#Text=Treason
#Text=Main article : Prince of Ning rebellion
#Text=Zhu Chenhao had long intended to rebel , but he did not have an army or even bodyguards .
#Text=This situation started with his ancestor Zhu Quan .
#Text=At that time , when the Yongle Emperor acceded to the throne he relocated Zhu Quan ( 1st Prince Of Ning ) to Beijing .
#Text=Then , to prevent Zhu Quan 's treason , his army and bodyguards were withdrawn and never restored until Zhu Chenhao 's reign .
#Text=Rise to power
#Text=In the summer of 1507 , in Zhengde Emperor 's era , Zhu Chenhao sent a eunuch to Beijing with an enormous bribe for Liu Jin .
#Text=The prince wanted Liu Jin to restore his princely bodyguards and its revenues in return for the bribe .
#Text=Although the Ministry Of War objected , the princely bodyguard was restored but it was withdrawn again in September 1510 , the day before Liu Jin was executed .
#Text=Zhu Chenhao was undaunted .
#Text=He tried again to restore his army in 1514 through the Ministry Of War , Lu Wan .
#Text=Several years before , Lu Wan was an officer in Jiangxi and supporter to the prince .
#Text=Lu Wan agreed to do it , but Grand Secretary Fei Hong refused to sign the draft ; in other words he did not approve the request since he knew what the prince would do .
#Text=However , the prince had plotted with some imperial officials such as Qian Ning , Cang Xian , several eunuchs and some of Emperor Zhengde 's personal staff to cheat Fei Hong .
#Text=The plot was a success , Fei Hong was befooled and the Imperial decree was issued , the prince bodyguards being restored .
#Text=In June 1514 , the prince requested seals to give him authority to control the military army in his region .
#Text=He also recruited hundreds of bandits to become his henchmen .
#Text=In August 1514 , Zhu Chenhao requested authority to punish guilty Imperial Clansmen .
#Text=With recommendation from Lu Wan , Zhengde Emperor agreed .
#Text=By this time , the Prince Of Ning referred to himself as ruler , his bodyguards as Imperial attendants and his order as imperial edicts .

#Text=He also order local officials to wear formal court robes when attending to him . Jiangxi Governor , speaking on behalf of his subordinates , said that it would be improper and refused to do it .
#Text=Zhu Chenhao began to recruit strategists and advisors to his cause .
#Text=His principal advisor was a provincial examination graduate versed in military strategy .
#Text=Local officials who refused to support the prince were eliminated .
#Text=A Judicial Intendant of Jiangxi who reported the prince 's treason to the court , was arrested and killed .
#Text=Under these circumstances , other local officials cooperated and said nothing .
#Text=In May 1517 several eunuchs from Zhu Chenhao 's household secretly went to Beijing to report his unlawful activities .
#Text=Commander of Imperial Bodyguard Qian Ning reported this to the prince , then the eunuchs were arrested and beaten to die before reaching their objective .
#Text=Uprising

#Text=In July 1519 , when Zhu Chenhao was attending a banquet in honor of his birthday , a spy arrived from Beijing with the news that high officials had been sent to arrest him , for that was what had been rumored in Beijing .
#Text=He left the banquet at once and called an urgent meeting of his advisors .
#Text=They all agreed that the prince 's plot was known , and could not wait any longer to take action .
#Text=On 10 July 1519 , Zhu Chenhao assembled local officials and announced that eunuch Li Kuang had fooled Hongzhi Emperor into thinking that Zhengde Emperor was his son .
#Text=According to him , the person on the throne was the child of a commoner .
#Text=The prince also announced that he had received an edict from the empress to punish those bandits .
#Text=Sun Sui , governor of Jiangxi asked the prince to show the empress 's edict , but he was rejected .
#Text=Then Sun Sui accused the prince of treason .
#Text=Sun Sui and several officials who refused to cooperate were executed summarily .
#Text=The prince 's army issued out from his headquarters , the city of Nanchang , to secure the route to the Yangtze River .
#Text=Jiujiang city fell on 13 July and the prefectural city of Anqing was besieged on 23 July .
#Text=When this news reached Wang Yangming , governor of Southern Jiangxi at that time , he soon took action .
#Text=Wang Yangming spread a false report that a huge Imperial army from Beijing was marching to Nanchang .
#Text=The Prince Of Ning did not dare to leave his headquarters for several days until he realized it was a false report .
#Text=On 9 August , the rebel Prince and his main army reached Anqing and besieged the city over ten days .
#Text=After many lives were lost , Anqing city still could not be taken .
#Text=On 13 August , Wang Yangming and his army reached Nanchang .
#Text=The prince 's headquarters was not garrisoned well and only a few soldiers of the army defended the city .
#Text=Soon after the siege of Nanchang news reached Zhu Chenhao , he ordered a retreat from Anqing and back to Nanchang to protect his base .
#Text=Wang Yangming stormed Nanchang and had a serious battle with the Prince of Ning .
#Text=Then on 20 August , the rebel Prince and his army were totally defeated by Wang .
#Text=The prince was going to flee with a small boat but it was discovered by Wang .
#Text=Wang burned the boat before the prince reached it , and soon the prince was captured .
#Text=Wang Yangming successfully put down the uprising that lasted for forty days .
#Text=Death
#Text=All allies of the Prince of Ning were captured , including the commander of the Imperial guard , Qian Ning and the Minister of War , Lu Wan .
#Text=Both were punished by death by slicing .
#Text=The Imperial status of Zhu Chenhao was removed in 1519 and he was allowed to take his own life on 12 January 1521 , after which his corpse was burned .
#Text=All of the prince 's family members were also executed .
